description:
A two-chapter prologue of Another about Reiko during her high school days.

Note: The manga was first released as a bundle with a prequel OVA to the anime then later republished in hardcover format with a side story novel to the main series, subtitled “Episode S”.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

name.native: 榊原 理津子（さかきばら りつこ）

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kiyo_unagi) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=22954) | [Blog](http://sugarless310.web.fc2.com/)

In 2005, he made his commercial debut with **"Sakura Iro Symmetry"**, published in Monthly Shonen Ace's May issue (Kadokawa Shoten). His representative works include the manga version of "[Kimi ni Shika Kikoenai](https://anilist.co/manga/41438/Kimi-ni-Shika-Kikoenai/)" and manga version of "[Another](https://anilist.co/manga/54098/Another/)".

He has also worked as a cover illustrator for novels such as "Q" series ([Bannou Kanteishi Q no Jikenbo](https://anilist.co/manga/78899/Bannou-Kanteishi-Q-no-Jikenbo), [Bannou Kanteishi Q no Suirigeki](https://anilist.co/manga/89578/Bannou-Kanteishi-Q-no-Suirigeki/) and **Bannou Kanteishi Q no Tanpenshuu**),  "[Tantei no Tantei](https://anilist.co/manga/103622/Tantei-no-Tantei/)" series and other works by [Keisuke Matsuoka](https://anilist.co/staff/116497/Matsuoka-Keisuke), and has designed characters for games such as the PlayStation 4 game "Blue Revolution Valkyria".

In 2015, Kodansha and KADOKAWA published an art book to celebrate his 10th anniversary.

__Spouse__: [Fuyumi Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/97723/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayatsujiyukito) | [Wikipedia (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B6%BE%E8%BE%BB%E8%A1%8C%E4%BA%BA)

Novelist who specializes mostly in mystery & horror. He wrote ten short mystery novels like his early study "Shonen Tanteidan" during the summer vacation of his sixth year of elementary school.

After graduating from Kyoto Prefectural Katsura High School in 1979, he entered the Faculty of Education at Kyoto University. He was a member of the Kyoto University Mystery Story Study Group. Among his classmates in the club was [Fuyumi Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/97723/Ono-Fuyumi), whom he would later marry, as well as [Takemaru Abiko](https://anilist.co/staff/147116/Abiko-Takemaru) and __Rintaro Norizuki (法月綸太郎)__, who would become authors. In the winter of his fourth year at university, he entered the Edogawa Rampo Prize with a work that was the prototype for the later "[Jukkakukan no Satsujin](https://anilist.co/manga/111509/Jukkakukan-no-Satsujin/)," and was selected in the first round.

In 1984, he entered the Graduate School of Education at the same university, majoring in deviant behavior theory, and married [Fuyumi Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/97723/Ono-Fuyumi) in 1986. The following year, while still in school, he made his debut as a writer with "[Jukkakukan no Satsujin](https://anilist.co/manga/111509/Jukkakukan-no-Satsujin/)". The editorial department of Kodansha Novels named it a "New Authentic Mystery". He completed his master's degree in two years and went on to study for a doctorate for three years, but then took a leave of absence for three years and withdrew with credits without writing a doctoral thesis. In March 1992, he became a full-time writer., and in the same year, he won the Mystery Writers Association of Japan Award in the feature story category for "Tokeikan no Satsujin".

As of February 2012, the total number of copies of his representative works, the "Kan series," has exceeded 4.09 million. It consists of 9 novels:
- Jukkakukan no Satsujin (十角館の殺人) - 1987
- Suishakan no Satsujin (水車館の殺人) - 1988
- Meirokan no Satsujin (迷路館の殺人) - 1988
- Ningyokan no Satsujin (人形館の殺人) - 1989
- Tokeikan no Satsujin (時計館の殺人) - 1991
- Kuronekokan no Satsujin (黒猫館の殺人) - 1992
- Ankokukan no Satsujin (暗黒館の殺人) - 2004
- Bikkurinkan no Satsujin (びっくり館の殺人) - 2006
- Ki menkan no Satsujin (奇面館の殺人) - 2012

title.native: 未来日記・パラドックス
